From Couture to Cinema: Why Is Saint Laurent Leaping into Film? Saint Laurent Productions' recent venture into film production is a stellar example of business agility and innovation. If you have not heard, the French fashion house stepped into the cinematic world just last year, co-producing three films for the 77th Cannes Film Festival. The move is exciting and a strategic masterstroke highlighting businesses' need to diversify and rethink their revenue streams. The global economy demands agility and foresight. Saint Laurent's leap into film, collaborating with producers like Sa√Ød Ben Sa√Ød, showcases a brilliant use of their brand strength to explore new territories. Besides adding revenue, it will enrich the brand's narrative and connect with audiences in new ways. Watching Saint Laurent navigate this transition inspires optimism for the future of cross-sector innovation. By stepping into cinema, they're not just making movies‚Äîthey're weaving resilience and growth into their brand story in an era full of challenges and possibilities. I love this story and can't wait to watch the movies! https://lnkd.in/e6uu2gXJ

The Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity came to a close last week. The Publicis-owned Leo Burnett emerged as the most successful Indian representative with 45 points followed by McCann Worldwide at 28. Ogilvy stood third with 23 points. India won 18 metals, its lowest tally since 2019 when it had won the same number of Lions. There was no Grand Prix for any Indian agency. The shiniest of Lions were two yellow metals, one for McCann Worldgroup - Gurugram and the other for Leo Burnett (Subsidiaries of Publicis Groupe) - Mumbai. 1. McCann Worldgroup (CEO APAC- Prasoon Joshi) bagged India's first Gold metal of the year at Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity 2024 in the 'Health and wellness' category. It won it for the "Fit My Feet" campaign that it crafted for Buckaroo India Footwear. Incidentally, this campaign also bagged a bronze metal in the same category and was also shortlisted for the 'Brand experience and activation' category. Your business needs Video...for the long term, not just short term. Video should be central to your brand awareness campaigns (yes I'm bias). Video can and will absolutely unlock new clients, new connections and brand awareness as an outcome to a successful campaign, but in my view taking the long game into consideration in a video's concept at the point of the campaign is a gamechanger. Think of iconic legacy adverts such as Cadbury's Gorilla drummer, Haribo's Inner Child, John Lewis and Coca-Cola each Christmas - they achieved the brand vision on their campaign but serve as timeless brand awareness years after their creation. See past the campaign, is there a piece amongst your Video campaign which will show your business off and stand testament to your product or service in 5 years time? Brand awareness. Never overlook it. #brand #brandawareness #videocampaign #mindset #videoconcept #cinematography

The great thing about being a filmmaker is living vicariously through your projects. In a period of my life where I've felt especially drawn to the outdoors, I'm so grateful anytime I get to explore that in my work. This project for Sophisticated Country Lady was a dream, getting to focus specifically on the texture of nature. What do you see, feel, hear, and imagine? Just like the product, the video captures the elegance and magic of the countryside as well as the product itself. Authenticity is always the best route in a brand film, finding the beating heart behind a product, and matching its energy. #fashionfilm #brandfilm #marketing #advertising
